data.meanings: To be abundant in weath, possess an abundance of property.
data.sentence: The word مَالَهُ comes from the root م و ل and is associated with the meanings: To be abundant in weath, possess an abundance of property.

data.meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.
data.sentence: The word يَحْسَبُ comes from the root ح س ب and is associated with the meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.

data.meanings: To remain/stay/dwell/abode, to remain or continue incessantly/always/endlessly/forever/perpetually, to adorn another with ornaments, to be slow in becoming hoary (when advanced in age), endowed with perpetual vigour
data.sentence: The word أَخْلَدَهُ comes from the root خ ل د and is associated with the meanings: To remain/stay/dwell/abode, to remain or continue incessantly/always/endlessly/forever/perpetually, to adorn another with ornaments, to be slow in becoming hoary (when advanced in age), endowed with perpetual vigour
